content: how do i…… q do a front post or back post stitch a post stitches are worked around the post of the stitch below instead of through the top of the stitch they can be accomplished using any stitch except a slip_stitch but a single_crochet is not advisable to use for this technique the usual stitch you might see in a pattern is a front post or back post double_crochet or triple crochet fpdc bpdc fptc bptc my example photos will be showing the stitches done with double_crochet here is what it looks like when completing a double_crochet the normal way for a front post double_crochet you would yarn over then insert the hook from front to back around the post of the stitch like this from this position you yarn over and pull up a loop from here you complete the stitch as you would any double_crochet for a triple crochet the only difference is that you yarn over twice before pulling up the loop around the post a back post stitch is simply worked by doing your yarn over then inserting your hook from the back to front of the fabric around the post here is what it looks like from the other side yarn over and pull up a loop now complete the stitch as usual again working for a double triple or taller stitch is simply a matter of the number of yarn overs needed before pulling up your loop around the post here are some examples of what you can do with this technique by copperscaledragon copperscaledrago ravelry id
